channel.title: miljko tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from miljko.

item.description: @dianeheids @adamcifu @CDCgov It's abuse. Imagine a government-funded infomercial suggesting to "Talk to your lawyer if‚Ä¶"

This *is* a mental health issue, but not (only) of those who shoot. https://t.co/9eP2w6LGpl

‚ÄúTo be able to suppress your dislike or lack of interest in things and just do them to gain an extrinsic rewards like money or grades is a superpower when it comes to being professionally successful, but I‚Ä¶ can‚Äôt?‚Äù Med school selects for those who can! https://t.co/c3n9M3bITl
@adamcifu @CDCgov ‚ÄúTalk to your health care provider if‚Ä¶‚Äù So nice of the CDC to put other people‚Äôs skin in their own poorly thought-out game.
Funny that the phrase ‚Äústylized facts‚Äù started out in economics and is being used in social sciences when 100% of clinical medicine is, in fact, based on stylized facts. https://t.co/20zQULtssV

Since then: BTC -37% SP500 -5% Gold -2% ‚Ä¶and food (including olives) +9% The greatest trick the devil ever pulled was to convince the world that obvious things aren't obvious. https://t.co/RkOm5KKYRb
@trishankkarthik Just started reading. So far so good. 70s vibes aged better than the 90s.

@trishankkarthik @nntaleb Jobs coming back was necessary but not sufficient for Apple to rebound. He needed to poach Cook, promote Ive‚Ä¶ Those things would hardly have happened if Jobs had thought ‚Äúhe, alone, can fix this‚Äù. What the story was to investors and public is another matter. But res non verba.

üß™ Happy to see Quanta magazine recognized for its outstanding science reporting. Their website is an oasis! https://t.co/PpDQyVMJ0e

üìö Social networks aren‚Äôt the problem, ignorance is. Carl Sagan called it 30 years ago. So if you are annoyed by Twitter‚Äôs overall tone maybe schools are more to blame than we admit, on all sides and at all levels of education? https://t.co/TgZnrRVlzb

@NTallapragada @patrickc The mantra used to be that industry goes for quick gains while academics are pursuing long-term, seemingly unreachable goals. Doubt that's ever been completely true, but now it's quite obviously turned on its head.

üìö Five months into the year, and I‚Äôve abandoned my first book: The Ministry for the Future. Broad strokes and cipher characters √† la Three Body Problem just didn‚Äôt go well with the specific issues The Ministry‚Ä¶ was trying to raise.
